is a new type of map representation which is storing which is modeling the environment as is

on the left and then we're going to go together through the details on the right so what is a three dynamic scene graph
is a graph hierarchical graph representation in which there are multiple layers
and the basic idea is that the lowest layer you have just sematic semantic mesh which is the
same that you got with kimera but the more you go up in the layers the more you obstruct away the low-level
geometry into high-level semantic concepts for example a liar ii you capture
objects and agents right without worrying about the entire mesh you just isolate objects regions
at layer 3 you detect places and structures places essentially a collision-free
location the robot can move to while structures are ceiling walls and so on
and you can go up for indoor environments into segmented rooms buildings and so on
so more formally a td dynamic signal is a directed graph where nodes represent spatial concepts and ages represent
spatial temporal relations within concepts so why this is a powerful representation
well first of all we finally are able to capture relation among different objects which we saw was a kind of a key to high
level understanding second for those of you are familiar with mapping for robotics this
representation is unifying metric maps such as the mesh at the bottom layer
with topological maps so the graph of places is just a topological map of the environment
moreover this kind of representation is starting to capture objects rooms buildings phases so this representation
is really suitable for uh motion planning task planning and just decision making for robotics

all the details of the architecture i just want to give you a couple of insights about what's what's inside this
architecture and the first insight is that 3d scene understanding really involves
asynchronous perception processes running at different rates for example if you want to do a 3d scene
understanding you will have to do some image processing and some low-level perception tasks
which have to run very fast and they are just running at sensor rate
you have to combine these with the tasks such as for example mesh reconstruction or visually natural
dominantly which are what we call mid-level perception processes which can run a little bit slower and
can reason over short time horizon and then you always end up having high level perception processes which have to
reason over the entire map and some of the the mass is lower because they have reason over the entire map
so really because of this presence of multiple perception processes which are asynchronous that are planning at
different rates a key tool that you have to deploy is that we have to make
our perception system highly parallelized just to enable real-time operation
the second challenger inside is that again we we cannot really hope to
rebuild a 3d singer from scratch after loop closure because that will really prevent real-time operation

graph optimization which is just correcting the scene graph every time there is a loop closure in

complex perception system requires solving many perception problems
including for example object detection in either point clouds or from images
as well as for example the estimation of the trajectory of the robot which is something that before i called postgraph
optimization so for a perception system we have to solve all these challenges
the nice opportunity here is that despite the diversity of these problems
from object detection to pose estimation here in the background of this perception
problem you end up solving some optimization problem and that's a commonality across all these perception
problems so the type of optimization problem that you end up solving is something like this
in which you're trying to estimate a quantity of interest let's say the x for example is the pose of the car that you
want to localize um you are given a bunch of measurements why i for example the measurements are i
don't know feature detections that you have from the image and you're trying to find the x
which is minimizing the residual errors the residual error is a given function which is quantifying how well your
estimate is explaining the measurements and of course in practice you're going to have
a large set of measurements that you're given so this is a very general formulation
for a bunch of perception problems the unfortunate thing that is preventing robustness is prevent is making existing
system brittle is that in practice they're going to have they're going to be many measurements y i which are outliers
which are completely wrong for example if you're doing feature detection and you want to estimate the
pose of this car some of the feature detections may be completely off came completely wrong
and if you're solving this optimization problem without flyers you're going to get a bad estimate for the x
so of course like you know we are not the first to encounter problems without flyers what we can do is just look at
the literature or robust estimation and people in robust estimation will tell us that the solution to
reducing the impact of outliers is to put a robust loss function in front of our receivers instead of minimizing the
squared norm of the residuals we can minimize the robust loss function raw
and um so we have this general recipe to have to solve perception these
optimization problems arising in perception in the presence of outliers and my question is then why the state of
the art is still brittle why the state of the art is still suffering from these outliers
well the reason is simple people in robust estimation theory they told us how to formulate the problem right this
is how to estimate the x in a robust way but they didn't tell us how to solve this optimization problem
okay what happens is that for common choices of robust loss function raw
for example this is a popular one which is a truncatedly square loss what happens is that the the cost
function is non-convex this is a non-convex function and therefore the overall optimization
problem is a non-convex optimization problem i'm sure many of you will be familiar with optimization but
